chapter.text: NBS 1: NBS 1

NBS 2: Narad took number of births to finish off his vasanas/desires. (Human birth is taken because of passion or to live through certain experiences. Even a desire for food out of passion and not utmost necessity to keep body-soul together causes a re-birth.)
NBS 3: Jnana and Vairagya accompany Bhakti.
NBS 4: Six Mind training traits are discrimination, dispassion, calm, obedient, single pointed and burning desire for liberation.
NBS 5: Bhakti is God-Love. Only God can give love for love not worldly temporary relations.
NBS 6: Hearts of sages are saints are soft, they preach to reduce suffering.
NBS 7: When all our thoughts like continuous flow of Ganga gushes towards that idol, continuously, unbrokenly, endlessly is called Bhakti.

NBS 8: Love requires nothing else. Bhakti alone is supreme. It does not require knowledge, meditation, asana, pranayama. Where Bhakti is, single pointedness of mind is but natural since mind automatically goes towards beloved. If you love you will come to know about beloved, knowledge.
NBS 9: Not love but supreme love i.e. total identification with the beloved. Not just love but love for the supreme who is the very self in everyone.
NBS 10: NBS 2
NBS 11: Adjective is param prem to point the Intensity of love.
NBS 12: Sneha is asakti/attachment/clinging is lower form of love towards something lower and prem is higher love towards the supreme.
NBS 13: What you 'fall into' love it is sneha and when you rise/grow/transform in love then it is higher form of love.

NBS 14: Lower form of love falls into one out of many, example one girlfriend i.e. it causes isolation, excluding other people from our love. Thus this form of love only causes loneliness because we keep excluding people.
NBS 15: Higher form of love is the many, example, when I love the nation , I love all citizens or, when I love God , I love everyone.
NBS 16: Attachment/sneha is based on likes-dislikes.
NBS 17: You like someone because of something and you love someone in spite of something.
NBS 18: In lower form of love there is element of desire/want/likes-dislikes, in higher form of love there is fulfilment it has element of giving/sacrifice/offer not demanding.
NBS 19: Lower form of love is selfish and higher form is self inclusive.
NBS 20: Lower form of love, it shatters, binds, creates agitations.
NBS 21: Higher form of love, it sets you free, not even clinging to the beloved and thus there is no insecurity or fear. There can be pain and sorrow in love.
NBS 22: Those who do not know how to bear pain and sorrow are not fit for love.
NBS 23: Love cannot bear the suffering of the beloved.
NBS 24: Bliss is beyond joy, excitement or suffering.
NBS 25: In lower form of love when you are bound to something (like body), there will be insecurity, when there is an element of desire, fear will be there.
NBS 26: In lower form, when there is no mutual gain it comes to an end but higher form of love is ever-increasing, it never comes to an end. It always remains fresh.
NBS 27: Love is giving not begging.
NBS 28: Measure of intensity of love :
NBS 29: 1. Unconditional i.e. even if there is an occasion to break, it never breaks or ends.
NBS 30: 2. Measure of intensity of love depends on identification or our intensity of feeling of oneness with the beloved (not how much we get out of the relationship).
NBS 31: 3. How much we are ready to sacrifice and give.
NBS 32: Highest form of identification/oneness is that there is no me other than my beloved.
NBS 33: Highest form of giving is I give myself up to Him.

NBS 34: When that identification/oneness takes place that unquestionable, un-wanting love for the lord which seeks no return whatsoever then we become recognised with that is the nature/essence of love.
NBS 35: Nature of love is amrita- swaroop/immortality natured. Love is nature of immortality, it can never come to an end. Its very nature is bliss itself.
NBS 36: Bhakti is total identification with the beloved, and lord is eternal bliss/amrita.
NBS 37: On that sharad purnima night when lord was fluting, he did not call any body but he was expressing his bliss through fluting and this bliss was captured by hearts of his devotees.
NBS 38: The devotee now has no separate existence or ego beyond the beloved thence the devotee and beloved become one, is called as Bhakti.
NBS 39: Bhakti does not run away...
NBS 40: On renouncement ego can be there.
NBS 41: Attainment of Love in heart is itself siddhi, devotee becomes soft, compassionate like lord's heart, he becomes sweet like God.
NBS 42: Nature/elements just plays for a lover, conventional siddhis just come, uninvited and un-seeking.
NBS 43: Finite objects can never get satisfaction.
NBS 44: But, Love for supreme bestows unique satisfaction, unending satisfaction. In this satisfaction there is no satisfaction. In this constant love, there is no end.
NBS 45: NBS 3
NBS 46: Non satisfaction in love is itself satisfaction. Radha finds satisfaction only in Krsna but she is never satisfied, there is never enough of time spent in/with Krsna for Radha.
NBS 47: In that constant thirst of love there is satisfaction.
NBS 48: Not even a trace of want for anything other than love of God.
NBS 49: Crying out of devotion is not same as ordinary crying which people do in temple.
NBS 50: Every desire arises out of incompleteness, I am finite, I am limited, I am incomplete. But, if the desired thing itself is finite how will it complete you.
NBS 51: Fulfilment can only be gained from infinite. Thus, love for world itself brings fulfilment/completeness.
NBS 52: Lord knows whats best for us, why is there need to ask. Whatever is absolutely needed, He has already provided to us.

NBS 53: The only thing a devotee asks for the lord is to increase his love towards him more and more, always and every moment. There is no other opinion/reaction to objects, things, people, place or situation. Everything is accepted as it is.
NBS 54: A lover cannot bear the sorrow of the beloved & vice-versa. If I suffer, will my lord not suffer. How can I cause pain to my beloved by being miserable or sorrowful.
NBS 55: Please don't grieve Arjuna because God cannot bear grief of his devotee.
NBS 56: When there is no desire there is no grief. Example, Sati in Daksha's yagna and the repercussions.

NBS 57: Lord is free of all desires thus sorrow cannot touch him, He is thus embodiment of love and compassion. Ishwar means who has wealth, beauty, knowledge, renunciation, etc. to the fullest extent i.e. aishwarya. Bhagwan means one who is embodiment of love and compassion.

NBS 58: No desire in world, no situation in the world, no losses in the world, no want so no sorrow; at the same time how can a devotee allow any sorrow to even touch himself because it will make his beloved who is anand swarupa, sad.

NBS 59: Not hates anything or anyone because everything is an expression of his lord. First quality of a devotee is non-hatred towards anyone. No likings or hatred, disliking, grief and enthusiasm or interest towards worldly matter. But wants more and more love of the lord.

NBS 60: Revels only in the lord not in the world since it is temporary. In the world nothing can create enthusiasm in the devotee other than service of the lord. Does not cry over/grieve over anything in the world.
NBS 61: The lover has got no other thoughts than beloved. In love there is such self forgetfulness and thoughts of me, me me and only remembrance of the blissful lord.

NBS 62: Expression of love is in giving, sharing and service. In what way we can serve rather than make our god or guru serve us. One who has desire what will they serve but will only make demands from god/guru. And, how those, who are themselves taking/wanting service, can serve any body.
NBS 63: Not sits and cries over personal weaknesses, desires.
NBS 64: When you hate anybody that person occupies your mind.
NBS 65: Devotee cant afford to hate anyone because here is no place for anybody else in the heart of the devotee.

NBS 66: Revelling in service is not for oneself, the greatest joy of the lover is to see if my beloved gets happy. Example:  in anxiety and excitement to put padukas in guru's feet, you trip guru only. (Quality of one's emotion must be congruent to original blissfulness of the lord).
NBS 67: For a devotee to whom nothing in this world is dear becomes dear to the lord. After such a devotee god runs.
NBS 68: At utterance of Ra -m, God rewards conveniences, at utterance of Ra-dha god runs after the devotee.
NBS 69: Choose god and god alone.
NBS 70: Shiv ji drinks bhaang, he drinks poison also, one should drink both or none. Nothing can intoxicate you like Love.
NBS 71: Mad person sees what we do not see. (Geeta verse 2.69). Example, Meera.
NBS 72: He is atmaramo bhavti, who revels in self, in inner chambers of his heart with the beloved.
NBS 73: In that maddening intoxication of love, lover becomes silent, meditative, steady, firm in faith like a rock but not a dull existence because he is atmaramo bhavti.
NBS 74: Revelling in self centred ego and not in atma, we don't revel but are miserable.
NBS 75: Beauty, bliss, service of the beloved - revel.
NBS 76: With mind and heart, he gives service to the lord.
NBS 77: Guru dakshina is to get Ram chandra ji here. Ecstasy exhausts.
NBS 78: NBS 4

NBS 79: Lover lives intoxicatedly in realms of beloved and what is significant for world is insignificant for the devotee (Geeta verse 2.69). Not excited but calm, firm and steady. Revels only in atman. Body becomes like pineapple. And, God sees all this.
NBS 80: In both lust (full of desires) and attachment (selfish, holding on for own comfort) there is an element of love. Not even a trace of desire/selfishness is pure love.
NBS 81: Love + Desire = Lust
NBS 82: Attachment is dependance on objects of attachment, it is clinging to fulfil our own desire even at the cost of destruction but love only thinks about well-being of the beloved.
NBS 83: Love does not demand love in return because lover is satisfied in giving love.
NBS 84: God like love.

NBS 85: Tragedy is everybody is waiting to be loved but not daring enough to give love. We are ready to give love only if we get in return love. But, the joy of love is not only in receiving love but giving love.
NBS 86: Nyasa means to let go and not holding on or clinging to both worldly and religious activities. It is renunciation.
NBS 87: There are desire prompted activities which are not necessary but notions that I will get happiness from this object, people and happiness. These activities should be given up.
NBS 88: In bhakti renunciation does not mean giving up activities both worldly and secular, what is to be given up is the ego that i am the doer.
NBS 89: Devotion gets contaminated by desire and desire arises from ego/separateness from god.
NBS 90: (Egoism is defined as self -interest as the foundation of morality, or correct actions sprouted by the seed of love).

NBS 91: What can I do, everything like will, strength and ability has been provided by the lord. The subtle strength devoid of passion comes from lord through determination sustained by yoga and yogic practices.
NBS 92: Attitude is I should not stink in presence of the lord/deity i.e. give good emotions and thus receive good emotions.
NBS 93: Sanyaas is being lost in love so fully that there is no awareness of other.
NBS 94: Single minded, whole hearted and exclusive and non-other attention and focus towards lord.

NBS 95: Be above the happenings of the world, indifference towards its happenings and not hate the world; does not matter whether it/object/people/situation is there are not, example i don't like company of people then shunning it is not renunciation, you must be neither attracted nor repelled towards it. (Udasinta)

NBS 96: No other ashray, dependance on things for our sustenance, security or enjoyment, other than Lord. See where your mind goes. On whatever the mind depends upon for its happiness, there the mind is bound to go. Thus, other than lord no dependance on anything or anyone.
NBS 97: Nobody in this world will give you love for your love, only lord reciprocates.
NBS 98: Mind must be single pointedly be dependant on the lord - always.
NBS 99: Nobody gives/takes from you anything, only by grace of lord things happen.
NBS 100: Mind that can hold on to the lord, abide and merge in lord. Else those precious thoughts will be wasted in acquiring things which anyway will be provided by the lord.
NBS 101: When Tulsidas found out that ram- laxman were guarding his wealth , he gave up the wealth for which lord himself had to come and protect it.
NBS 102: Our minds are on lord because we depend on wealth for our security.
NBS 103: Devotee does not depend upon karma because he knows all results come by grace of lord.
NBS 104: Devotee does not depend upon his sadhna because our sadhna is to keep our mind on the lord, it is not a favour to the lord.
NBS 105: Devotee does not depend upon people/devtas because of exclusive single pointedness on him and him alone.
NBS 106: Those rituals not conducive to devotion should be given up, example pilgrimage and holy baths only if it were to please Him.
NBS 107: There is only one giver, provider and protector of the universe i.e. exclusive dependancy and thus mergence into Him.
NBS 108: Has hatred towards no one because everything in the world is an expression of God for the lover
NBS 109: Does not grieve over anything in the world Demand will cause trouble to God so no demand
NBS 110: No over enthusiastically in world except for service of God Wants more love and love of God
NBS 111: Forgetfulness of self and only remember of blissful lord Expression of love is direct service to him
NBS 112: Condition of a person in love:
NBS 113: Not grieving not excitement
NBS 114: In love drink both bhaang and poison if imitating Shiva Revels in atman
NBS 115: Guru dakshina get Ramachandra here
NBS 116: In love God is the goal
NBS 117: Anything that distracts you from thoughts, service and meditation of the beloved be indifferent to it i.e. no craving aversion to it
NBS 118: NBS 5
NBS 119: Uninterrupted flow of thoughts towards beloved is called love.

NBS 120: Nature of bhakti is renunciation and renunciation is offering of all our activities whether worldly or religious to him. What we have to renounce in these activities is our own ego and ego centric selfish desires like bodily comfort, safety, etc.

NBS 121: One must not have dependance on fruits of those activities. We do activities not for the lord but to get some result. Thus only those duties which are conducive to our personal devotion should be practiced. The excuse for avoidance of duties is generally laziness, thus those duties which release us from our likes and dislikes are conducive to our bhakti and must not be given up and are foremost in performance.

NBS 122: Otherwise we are ready to drop off everything we don't like in the name of devotion and meditation. Our feelings, thoughts and actions must all be dedicated to the lord, our beloved. And there should be no distraction from that performance of activity , and what distracts us is our hope for happiness from a particular object, action, person or situation and this has to be given up.

NBS 123: Thus, even vedic practices must be given up for a spiritual seeker because for a spiritual seeker only those actions which reduce our liking-disliking range are to be performed for attainment of salvation. Else, the mind creates only more suppressions/repression.
NBS 124: Only those actions born out of personal ego, desires and comfort/attachments are to be renounced.
NBS 125: Means/rules of developing devotion must be dropped when merging-love has been attained, example Shabri-Ram episode. Now, acts os such a devotee become rules.
NBS 126: Love knows no boundaries, no rules , all is fare in love.
NBS 127: In that supreme state of love, lord himself is there.

NBS 128: We get stuck to the means and forget the goal i.e. all our actions must bring us closer to lord. We get so entangled in steps, paraphernalia, the mantras that have to chanted with it that there is no devotion at that moment.
NBS 129: So that which increases devotion should be done, thus taste the fruits like shabri.
NBS 130: Till our conviction/commitment to live a life of whole hearted devotion has not become strong, rules of scriptures to be followed.

NBS 131: If you are unprepared and if give up and take on saffron then the existing vassanas/vrittis will remain and you incur you new vasanas. But, if you perform your duty without attachment, then existing vasanas will dissolve and free from desire you are a renunciate.
NBS 132: One is committed to develop devotion within oneself or that divine love, divine state, divine experiences becomes a protector of scriptures.
NBS 133: Meaning of conviction/commitment, 6 convictions for a devotee:

NBS 134: Wherever I am placed it is lord's will, whoever is in front of me, my interaction and service and also whatever at that moment we receive it is the will of lord, it is for the best. Thus conviction to follow lord's will.

NBS 135: Most of the obstacles are not outside, it is our own ego, selfishness, grievances, attachments, or actions born out of those or out to fulfil your desires should be given up and not performed/acted upon. Those feelings, thoughts, grievances and negativities should be dropped. Anything that comes between me and beloved, indifference towards that and not hatred. Obstacles should be renounced.

NBS 136: Dependance only on lord, that faith that my lord is there to do whatever is required and whatever is happening is his will it is for the best. Thus no fear or worry about anything or anyone. Whenever you are in difficulty or mind is agitated or disturbed, call out only to the lord of your heart. This is the conviction needed in devotion.
NBS 137: Keep your mind constantly at his feet and what is to be avoided is ego, pride, selfishness.

NBS 138: When we go in front of the lord, we are dressed appropriately i.e follow scriptural rules till you become fully immersed in devotion. Else there is fall, fall means deviation from constant remembrance.

NBS 139: Guru drinks both wine and molten iron when given with love and devotion. Don't misunderstand his love to be indulgence. Brahman is spread everywhere. Don't let means become obstacle to your devotion.
NBS 140: Even social work/giving discourses should be done after attaining devotion else it becomes bondage in goodness.
NBS 141: After one gets lost in devotion, God takes care and even worries of body sustenance should not occupy your mind.

NBS 142: The body does not belong to me but an instrument given to me by him for his service so I have right to take away life from it or make it incapable for service to him, pamper it or starve it; whether for pleasures or denial/neglect. Take food up to that extent only that body is capable of rendering service to the lord.

NBS 143: A lady wanted to shoot arjuna because he made lord his driver to win the battle and draupadi because she made lord her cloth. Whatever you can do with your mind on him, do. Don't make him your servant and work for you.

NBS 144: Draupadi had one hand holding her clothes and other raised calling krishna, but when even her own strength was not there, when her both hands went up, Bhagwan himself became cloth for her. This is ananyta/exclusiveness.
NBS 145: But, this lady says so what if she becomes naked but why she made lord her cloth i.e. don't neglect your body that Bhagwan has to look after you.
NBS 146: Signs of a committed person who has determination to attain devotion:
NBS 147: For sadhaka it is means/puja to practice, for a siddha it is natural.
NBS 148: Puja for anuraag i.e not just a ritual but finds great joy and love.
NBS 149: Lower/lover is the lord and you are the beloved.
NBS 150: Puja is action oriented, thoughts should be of love and service intensifies that love.
NBS 151: NBS 6
NBS 152: Signs of devotion in a person:
NBS 153: In earlier stages when we cannot see the lord in everything, everyone and everywhere, keep a picture of Him for remembrance. Love is giving, sharing, serving. Else

NBS 154: it is labour, without inspiration. Puja gives a feeling of love, joy, sense of satisfaction that even if you got nothing in return, you are happy. This is a sign of devotion, that you are devoted.
NBS 155: Love for listening to glories of lord. Finding love for lord in the glories.
NBS 156: A devotee/Radha rani understands that even in the childish pranks of Krishna there is some hidden beauty, love and message of the lord for you.
NBS 157: A devotee likes to preach and discuss about lord and show his lord to everyone.

NBS 158: The lord is such a lover of the universe that his every action is an expression for the universe. The anand swaroop of lord expressing itself is called love. When it gets reflected in heart of devotee is called bhakti.

NBS 159: But listening should not be a hindrance to your blissful meditation on the atman. Listening must not be for sense gratification alone. All external religious practices must make you realise the lord in self of your heart and also in the hearts of all the beings.

NBS 160: Dedications of all actions/secular, religious, spiritual at the altar of the lord AND forgetfulness of that must lead to excruciating pangs and pain. Are you doing puja/navda-vidhi for self gratification, or to get some result or is it just a love offering to the lord of your heart. (You are where your mind is).
NBS 161: Put chandan/tilak on his face as you would put it on your own, with delicacy, care, properly, attention, concentration and sweetness.
NBS 162: When every action becomes an expression of love, such care goes into it, that action itself becomes meditation.

NBS 163: And, if even for a minute if you forget Him then even a minute of forgetfulness or carelessness towards the beloved should cause param vyakulta or excruciating pangs/pain of separation because in love even hatred is actually not opposed to love because hatred causes remembrance which makes one like object of remembrance who is sat-cit-ananda in this case.

NBS 164: In love forgetfulness of the beloved is a crime. Just for one moment Sita ji's attention went to deer and what all she had to suffer. In Lanka, what she suffered was not what Ravan's tactics but her suffering was that she could not be close to Ram Chandra ji and serve him.
NBS 165: This is a sign that one has attained love - pain on forgetfulness. Best examples are gopis of Vrindavan :
NBS 166: This crime of forgetfulness of the knowledge of his glory even for a moment was not there in gopis' love.
NBS 167: We must know infinitude of lord then we fall into some fanaticism, attachment, possession even in the name of religion and even in devotion to the lord.

NBS 168: Element of finitude causes all jealousy, selfishness, lust. Example, why should i know what is sat, cit or ananda, is it not that i love my flute player with his peacock feather but then we get attached to the form and thus love gets limited.

NBS 169: Why knowledge of his greatness is needed, otherwise, the love for Krishna would be like the love of a paramour. It is only for self or sense gratification, its all about me and my feelings, not the happiness of the other.
NBS 170: love + desire = lust
NBS 171: If they did not know who krsna was then the whole bhagwat would be a teaching on how to have an extra marital affair.

NBS 172: Not for a moment these gopis forgot who Krsna was. During ras lila for a moment pride came and krsna disappeared, the gopis sang out to Krsna - we know you are not the son of gopika/yashoda, you are one witness of the inner equipments of everyone and it is only because of the plea of the devatas that you have taken a form, playing pranks and protecting us from demons.
NBS 173: Krsna tested them - why have you come abandoning your family/husbands in the middle of the night to forest where a man (me) is there alone?
NBS 174: Gopis said - don't you give us lecture on duty because all duty is done to reach you in whole.
NBS 175: Else, it may not be physical lust but only self importance, etc. Then Krsna allowed them to dance.

NBS 176: All duties are to develop vairagya (living and experiencing desires, vasanas fully), satsang and realise the lord of everyone's heart. If that duty takes you away from lord then that duty is not duty.
NBS 177: If you love someone who is free of lust, attachment you also become free of lust, attachment.
NBS 178: What is the harm of loving him without knowing his infinite glory:

NBS 179: Else it would be paramour type love, and in love of a paramour there is no happiness in giving the other person happiness, its for self satisfaction/ego. The sheer essence of love is finding happiness in giving happiness to the beloved.
NBS 180: There is no question of what did I get out of it. Lover finds fulfilment in love because there is no greater happiness than that.
NBS 181: When the dark one was not here, Radha was just sitting and all in her mind was Krsna, Krsna, Krsna...
NBS 182: Everywhere it was just you and you alone and when you came I melted in your embrace.
NBS 183: That one moment of forgetfulness/separation she cannot bear = ananyta.
NBS 184: Whom did we serve in our husbands, children !
NBS 185: First thing in morning after they got up, their thoughts
NBS 186: were Krsna, Krsna, while taking their bath Krsna, Krsna, washed their cows Krsna, Krsna, milked the cows Krsna, Krsna, churned the
NBS 187: milk Krsna, Krsna, when the butter emerged Krsna, Krsna , when they kept it in pots Krsna, Krsna, and they hung the pots Krsna, Krsna...all the time there is only one thought - Krsna.
NBS 188: Thus Krsna came stealing butter from their house, pots, stealing their clothes - to get their love (love instilled in their actioned butter, bodies and clothes for Krsna).

NBS 189: Narad muni thought what has happened to mu lord, people are gossiping, women hanging around him, pulling his clothes, teasing him, making him dance for a little butter, do they even know who he is ? Little did he himself know that...NBS 7
NBS 190: NBS 7

NBS 191: ...little did Narada know that to cure Krsna's headache by collecting dust of lotus feet of devotee, it were only the best of gopi radha and also other gopis who used to follow actions of radha in love of Krsna, who provided the dust without fearing for hellish punishments they may had to undergo for stepping on lord's head.
NBS 192: Radha ji asked a crying gopi why she was crying. Did the dark one trouble you again. Reply came that his troubles are also sweet. Just like the gopis of Vrindavan.
NBS 193: Because my mother in law troubled me I spent whole day brooding over that and forget Krsna, because I forgot Krsna i am crying.
NBS 194: What separate us from beloved is only our own thoughts, in spite of physical presence.

NBS 195: In love there is always the sense what does by beloved need and the need is delivered in spite of one's personal discomfort/unhappiness. But now the unhappiness becomes happiness because the mind is with lord who is ananda.
NBS 196: Selfish love causes pain. Happiness of devotee is in happiness of lord.
NBS 197: As you consider yourself so will be your relationship with others. So consider yourself as soul and seek the supersoul.
NBS 198: Step 1 :  He is so handsome and machoman
NBS 199: Step 2 :  He must be charming and gentleman
NBS 200: Step 3 :  He must be intelligent, spiritual.
NBS 201: Non knowledge of his infiniteness causes fanaticism.
NBS 202: 4 essentials of love:
NBS 203: A loving anxiety for the well being of the beloved; not cause agitation, disturbance, just for me me me, i must get what i want - not allowed but in happiness of beloved.
NBS 204: A sense of deep response, what action we are ready to do to bring happiness for the beloved, this is action.
NBS 205: A proper understanding/knowledge of the beloved, even to know who my beloved is, then only we would know what would he want of us.
NBS 206: Reverence for the beloved in whatever way he acts.
NBS 207: Be the one who makes Him feel that He exists.

NBS 208: When Uddhav went to gopis to tell about brahman and soul, he only found out that after experiencing a higher taste, the lower taste does not appeal much and now the fire of separation take place.
NBS 209: When Uddhav asked them why don't they send invitation to Him to come to Vrindavan they replied if Krsna wants to come, he would come, we don't want him to pressurise and even see us.

NBS 210: Then Uddhav tells them why don't they go to mathura, they replied what if he doesn't want to see us, busy with his work, cause embarrassment that the king of dwarka played with these milkmaids. It would be better to die with this excruciating pain than cause even slightest of privacy intrusion to Him without his wish. But we cannot die because even the life is not ours and if we give up our lives, will Krsna not be in pain.

NBS 211: Hanuman ji tells that Sita's life is just waiting to get out of her body. In fire of pain of separation from the beloved that body would be burnt but Sita ji has given the message that what to do these eyes are betraying by dropping tears which quench the fire because still the desire is there to see my beloved.

NBS 212: Finding happiness in the happiness of the beloved (essence of love), so sheer obedience to guru is necessary to time we know what my guru wants of me and guru only wants like the lord wants - perfect lover is happiness. But for our own selfish happiness, we will cause any pain, disgust, sorrow and that is not love and devotion.
NBS 213: Sorrow is not in separation of the beloved it is in forgetfulness and disobedience of the beloved. This is a symptom of love.

NBS 214: Those who have abundance of emotions (heart chakra), path of bhakti, path of knowledge for intellectuals , for those who are active, path of karma yoga/service/seva of nation, society and lord. For everybody else it is path of self-discipline or ashtanga yoga.
NBS 215: Narada ji points out bhakti path is greatest among all these.
NBS 216: Bhakti is identification with the beloved therefore it is oneness with the beloved.
NBS 217: Knowledge/meditation makes you recognise that you are already one.
NBS 218: Without seva, karma yoga your vasnas/vrittis will not get exhausted and so neither knowledge nor self less possible.
NBS 219: In love concentration/meditation is required and concentration is not possible without love/bhakti.

NBS 220: Knowledge is called the monkey path, in all other paths - yoga/meditation, knowledge, service/karma yoga, you have to hold on to your goal and not waiver from your goal. In meditation discipline is required, consistently apply your mind in knowledge of atman, brahman, etc. but in katha instant devotion takes place.
NBS 221: Ego is bundle of vasnas/habits/vrittis, a finititude.
NBS 222: Bhakti is kitten path, it does not require any logic. Exists always.
NBS 223: Bhakti is the goal of all other paths.
NBS 224: Bhakti is the fruit in itself, it is of the nature of final result.
